column4: hi there, im having a problem with my computer, i think i accidentally changed the /usr folder and recursive all the permissions to chmod 777. Alot of my ubuntu's features and functions are now not working, especially when i cannot mount an external HD. Is there a way to revert to the original?

ï»¿hi there, im having a problem with my computer, i think i accidentally changed the /usr folder and recursive all the permissions to chmod 777. Alot of my ubuntu's features and functions are now not working, especially when i cannot mount an external HD. Is there a way to revert to the original?
joapinto: will reinstall cause me to delete my /var and /home folder?
i would backup /home and clone package selections then reinstall and restore backup
